title: As a user I want to be able to search for a CSP Player Summary
custom_preconds: GIVEN A CSP/CEP Player Summary" is an option in the "Search for" dropdown.
custom_expected:
THEN
* Selecting " this will load the relevant filters according to the provided search requirements. 
* Conducting an advanced search will return the correct columns and the correct results set based on the filters selected.

title: As a user I want the CSP Summary tab on a professional player profile to look different based on the Signing Date of the player's CSP Contract
custom_steps:
Players who signed after 1/12/2005:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp

Players who signed after 10/3/2004 and before 1/12/2005:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp

Players who signed on or before 10/3/2004:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_legacy_-_before_10_3_2004


Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+Summary

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The CSP Summary tab should look different for players based on the CSP that they signed under. This distinction is driven by the Signing Date of the contract which contained a CSP clause for them. 
* For players who signed on or before 10/3/2004, the CSP Summary should match the provided wireframe and the "Original" data discovery. 
*  For players who signed after 10/3/2004 and before 1/12/2005, the CSP Summary should match the provided wireframe and the "Taxable Amount and Living Allowance/Tuition Allowance and Taxable Amount" data discovery (both on the same page in the requirements), with the exception of "Net Amount" in the Payment History. 
* For players who signed after 1/12/2005, the CSP Summary should match the provided wireframe and the "Taxable Amount and Living Allowance/Tuition Allowance and Taxable Amount" data discovery (both on the same page in the requirements).

title: As a user I want to be able to edit the CSP Summary on a professional player profile (Post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking edit puts the Summary tab into edit mode
custom_expected:
* The CSP Summary tab has an Edit button in view mode. 
* Special attention should be paid to the differences between the versions of CSP, such as the available CSP statuses, Date Completed fields and Net Amount field. Net Amount should NOT be required for contracts with a signing date between 1/12/2005 and 10/3/2004. 
* A Save button and a cancel button are available in Edit mode.
* Clicking "Save" will conduct a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field check has passed, the changes will be saved and a blue successful save notification will be displayed. The page will reload in View mode. 
* Any changes that were made to the Payment History are reflected in the associated Invoice.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are sure that they wish to lose any changes. If they confirm, the form is put back in view mode and no changes are saved. If they do not confirm, the modal is closed and they are returned to the form in edit mode with their changes still present.

title: As a user I want to be able to search for a CSP Invoice
custom_steps:
Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Search+-+CSP+Invoice

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "CSP/CEP Invoice" is an option in the "Search for" dropdown. 
* Selecting this will load the relevant filters according to the provided search requirements. 
* Conducting an advanced search will return the correct columns and the correct results set based on the filters selected.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP Invoice for an Employee
custom_preconds: Given user is on players CSP tab
custom_steps: When viewing the CSP tab of an Employee profile and Click "New Invoice" should load the invoice according the wire and data discovery, just like if this was a player.
custom_expected:
*if the user has the proper permissions, there is a New Invoice button.
* All rules and required field checks should work the same as if this were a player.

title: As a user I want to see Tuition Allowance Credits and Living Allowance Credits split out separately for invoices for CSP's post 10/3/04
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When User On Invoices for CSPs with a Signing Date after 10/3/2004, there are now going to be 2 separate Credit fields.
custom_expected:
* Invoices for CSPs with a Signing Date before 10/3/2004 will remain unchanged with the single Credit field. 
* See the wireframe for placement. 
* Credits will become Tuition Credits and Living Expenses Credits.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new CSP invoice (Pre 10/3/2004)
custom_preconds: GIVEN you are viewing a CSP Invoice in edit mode and there is a "Save" button.
custom_steps: WHEN making edits and Clicking the save button
custom_expected:
THEN
* It will run a required field and formatting check according to the provided data discovery. The fields required will vary slightly depending on what "Status" is selected for the Invoice (not the CSP Status).
* CSP Status, Net Amount and Date Completed fields should be paid special attention.
* Once the required field and formatting check and any other rule checks (covered in other stories) have passed, the form is saved. 
* The Created and Created By fields are set accordingly. 
* A blue successful save notification is displayed. 
* The Invoice appears in the player's Payment History on the Summary tab. 
* Any updates made to the CSP Status, Date Lapsed, or Date Completed fields are reflected on the player's CSP Summary.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new CSP invoice (Post 10/3/2004)
As a user I want to see an error when I enter a Total Amount equal to 0
custom_preconds: Given user is on players invoice tab
custom_steps: When user enter the amount equal to 0 on invoice and click save
custom_expected: Error will display message #11

title: As a user I want to see an error when I enter a Net Amount equal to 0
custom_preconds: Given user is on Player's Invoice tab
custom_steps: When clicking Save on an Invoice
custom_expected: *The Net Amount field is present and the Invoice Status = Paid, and the Net Amount equals 0, display an error. Messages #12

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing CSP credit (Pre 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a payment history in CSP
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on the term in the player's payment history
custom_expected:
THEN this action should launch the Credit for the user. 
AND If the Credit is for a player whose CSP signing date is on or before 10/3/2004, then the system will display the Credit according to the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The CSP Summary at the top of the Credit should be directly tied to the current information on the player's CSP tab (Not a snapshot). 
AND The CSP Summary section should be collapsed by default

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP credit (Pre 10/3/04)
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=legacy_credit


Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+Credit

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On the player's CSP Summary tab, there is a "New Credit" button. 
* For players whose CSP Signing Date is on or before 10/3/2004, clicking this button will launch a new CSP Credit for the player with a Summary section that matches the provided wire

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new CSP credit (Pre 10/3/2004)
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=legacy_credit

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+Credit

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing a CSP Credit in edit mode, there is a "Save" button. 
* Clicking this button will run a required field and formatting check according to the provided data discovery. 
* CSP Status, and Date Completed fields should be paid special attention.
* Once the required field and formatting check and any other rule checks (covered in other stories) have passed, the form is saved. 
* The Credit Issued and Issued By fields are set accordingly. 
* A blue successful save notification is displayed. 
* The Credit appears in the player's Payment History on the Summary tab. 
* Any updates made to the CSP Status, Date Lapsed, or Date Completed fields are reflected on the player's CSP Summary.

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing CSP credit (Post 10/3/04)
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=credit

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+Credit

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking on the term in the player's Payment History for a credit should launch the Credit for the user. 
* If the Credit is for a player whose CSP signing date is after 10/3/2004, then the system will display the Credit according to the wireframe and data discovery. 
* The CSP Summary at the top of the Credit should be directly tied to the current information on the player's CSP tab (Not a snapshot). 
* The CSP Summary section is collapsed by default

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP credit (Post 10/3/04)
custom_steps:

Data Discovery:

* On the player's CSP Summary tab, there is a "New Credit" button. 
* For players whose CSP Signing Date is after 10/3/2004, clicking this button will launch a new CSP Credit for the player that matches the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* The CSP Summary is different based on the signing date.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a CSP credit
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Club and BOC users with Edit permissions for Credits will see a "Delete" button on Credits in view or edit mode.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to confirm the deletion of the item. See Messages #22. 
* Confirming that they wish to delete will permanently delete the credit from the system and return the user to the point of entry and throw a blue notification saying "CSP Credit successfully deleted"
* Clicking No will dismiss the modal.

custom_steps: When viewing the CSP tab of an Employee profile, if the user has the proper permissions, there is a New Credit button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "New Credit" should load the invoice according the wire and data discovery, just like if this was a player. 
* All rules and required field checks should work the same as if this were a player.

custom_preconds: GIVEN CSP/CEP School" is an option in the "Search for" dropdown.
custom_steps: WHEN user selects CSP/CEP from the drop down
custom_expected:
THEN this will load the relevant filters according to the provided search requirements.

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing CSP school profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_school_profile

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking on the School Name in advanced search results will open the school profile.  
* The school profile will follow the format and layout of the wireframe.

title: As a user I want to be edit an existing CSP School Profile
custom_preconds: Given user is on Players CSP school profile
custom_steps: When user viewing an existing CSP School profile
custom_expected:
* View mode should have "Close" Button 
* When viewing an existing CSP School Profile in View mode there is a "Close" button. 
* Clicking "Close" will close the profile and return the user to the point of entry.
* When viewing an existing CSP School Profile, if the user has edit permissions they see an "Edit" button.
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the profile in edit mode, according to the wireframe and the data discovery. 
* In Edit Mode there will be a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose changes. If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode with none of the changes saved. If they do not confirm, the modal will close and the form will remain in Edit mode with the changes still in place. 
* Clicking "Save" will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field/format check has passed, the form will be saved and reloaded in View mode. 
* A successful blue save notification will display.

title: As a user I want to be able to see a "Schools" tab on the CSP/CEP Dashboard
custom_steps: Wireframe:http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_cep_schoolsData Discovery:https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=107118753Acceptance Criteria: * If a user has CSP view or edit permissions they see the "Schools" tab on the CSP/CEP Dashboard.* Clicking on the "Schools" tab will load the widget per the wireframe and the data discovery. * The browser tab text will say CSP/CEP Schools* The widget will be populated with all of the non-deleted CSP School profiles in the system. * The default sort will be on School Name. * Default column sort, filtering and exporting should work. * A submenu will be added to the main navigation with links in alphabetical order* Update the browser tab text to say CSP/CEP Players when the Players tab is active

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP/CEP School Profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_cep_schools

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+School

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On the Schools widget there should be a "Create New" Action Button for users with CSP edit permissions.
* Clicking this should launch a new, blank school profile. 
* Form should match the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* There should be a "Save" and  "Cancel" button in grey. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes, and if the user confirms it will discard the profile entirely and return the user to the point of entry. 
* Clicking "Save" will run a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. If that passes, the system will save the profile, display a blue success notification, and reload the form in view mode. 
* After the profile has been saved, it should be available for selection in Invoices and Player Letters.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to delete a CSP/CEP School Profile
custom_steps: Wireframe:http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=new_csp-cep_schoolData Discovery:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+SchoolAcceptance Criteria: * When a BOC user with CSP edit permissions is viewing a school profile, they should see a "Delete" button. * Clicking this should ask the user to confirm that they wish to permanently delete the school profile. * If the user confirms, the system will delete the school's profile. * A blue successful notification will display. * Invoices that have been saved with this school's information prepopulated should not be impacted.

title: As a user I want to see only CEP approved schools as options in the "School" list on CEP Invoices
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "School" selection field in the address section on CEP Invoices will be limited to school profiles that have either CEP or the both option selected on their profiles. 
* The "School Attending" field needs to be converted to a Select2 search field to match that of the School dropdown. This should also be limited to only CEP approved schools. 
* Both of these fields need to allow the user to easily find the school they want as described in story #150028404.

title: As a user I want to see only CSP approved schools as options in the "School" list on CSP Invoices
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* The "School" selection field in the address section on CSP Invoices will be limited to school profiles that have either CSP or the both option selected on their profiles.
* Both of these fields need to allow the user to easily find the school they want as described in story #150028404.

title: As a user I want to see only CEP approved schools as options in the "School" list on CEP Summaries
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* The "School" selection field in the address section of the Player Letter popout from the CEP Summary should be limited to school profiles that have either CEP or the both option selected on their profiles.
* This field needs to allow the user to easily find the school they want as described in story #150028404.

title: As a user I want to see only CSP approved schools as options in the "School" list on CSP Summaries
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* The "School" selection field in the address section of the Player Letter popout from the CSP Summary should be limited to school profiles that have either CSP or the both option selected on their profiles.
* This field needs to allow the user to easily find the school they want as described in story #150028404.

title: As a user I want to be able to quickly email an attachment to someone
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User can view attached files and download the attachment they will see an email icon for each attached file


Business Value Description: 
In the current system all files are emailed from Clubs to the BOC and they copy the Player's Union on the files so that they do not have to email them separately. Now that this step has been eliminated, the BOC needs a quick way to email the uploaded files to the Union.
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking on this email icon will launch a pop-up for the user to enter in the desired email address(es), subject and body of an email. 
AND Subject should default to "Last, First - Label" with the "Label" being the selected label on the attached file.
AND Clicking "Send" after populating the required fields will email the uploaded file to the entered address(es). 
AND The email will in some way indicate that it is being sent on behalf of the user, and not just "ebis".

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to show/hide the low-level roles assigned to each user
custom_preconds: Given User is Logged in as BOC
custom_steps: When user click Utilities > User Accounts  there should now be a Detailed Permissions toggle at the top of the User Account page
custom_expected:
* This should default to "Off"
* When this is set to "Off" the user accounts screen will NOT display the low level LDAPs for each user. 
* Switching this to "On" should refresh the page to display the low level LDAPs for each of the users on the page (any filters applied, like Org, should remain applied). 
* Nancy also wants to know if when this is set to "Off" if we can hide the "Misc Permissions", too.

title: As a user I want to be able to export the user accounts page
custom_preconds: Given User on User Account under utilities
custom_steps: When Clicking "Export" will generate an xls export of the user accounts currently visible in the utility per the applied filters, including the "Detailed Permissions" toggle.
custom_expected: * All users who have access to the User Accounts page should see an "Export" button on the page.

title: As a Club user I don't want to see "Misc Permissions" in the user accounts page
custom_preconds: Given User is Logged in as Club
custom_steps: When user click Utilites > User account >Under Permissions
custom_expected:
* Club users no longer see "Misc Permissions"
* BOC users should continue to see this.

title: As a user I want the accounts listed in the user accounts page to be sorted alphabetically
custom_preconds: Given User is logged in as Club or BOC
custom_steps: When User click Utilities > User Account > Select the org
custom_expected: * Both Club and BOC users should see the User Accounts listing sorted alphabetically by user Last Name, with a secondary sort on First Name.

title: As a user I want to run the CSP Lapse Batch
custom_steps:
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+Lapse+Batch

Wires (generic): 
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contrat_expiration
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=global_results_widget

Acceptance Criteria
* "CSP Lapse" is a batch option under the "Minor Contracts/CSP" section on the batch screen.
* Clicking "CSP Lapse" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
* The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
* A "Run" button is available. 
* Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
* Running the batch will find all of the CSP's that should be lapsed, and update the CSP information accordingly (see rules). 
* Any player who had their CSP information updated as a result of this batch running should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Player ID, Player's Name, Org, Club, and Roster Status. 
* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: School - Permissions
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When User click on CSP Summary
custom_expected:
*This form should share permissions with the CSP Summary - no new LDAP should be created*
* The form has a view only permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but cannot edit anything.  Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.csp
* The form has an edit permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view and edit CSP Schools. Users without the permission cannot edit CSP Schools anywhere in the system.

title: Credit - Permissions
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP TAb
custom_steps: When User Click on CSP Summary
custom_expected:
*This form should share permissions with the CSP Summary - no new LDAP should be created*
* The form has a view only permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but cannot edit anything.  Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.
* The form has an edit permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view and edit CSP Credits. Users without the permission cannot edit CSP Credits anywhere in the system.

title: Invoice - Permissions
custom_steps:
1. WHEN I view an invoice as a view-only account

2. WHEN I view an invoice as a boc account
custom_expected:
1. THEN I can see the invoice and print but not edit

2. THEN I can see, print and edit the invoice

title: Summary - Permissions
custom_steps:
1. WHEN I view a CSP summary as the view-only account

2. WHEN I view a CSP summary as an boc account
custom_expected:
1. THEN I can view and print from the summary

2. THEN I can view, print and edit the summary

title: As a user I want to be able to print an Acknowledgment letter from an Invoice (hooking up the print button to the built out letter)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player Invoice tab
custom_steps: When viewing a CSP Invoice in edit mode, there is a "Print" button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking this button will launch a pop up where the user will have the ability to select the Acknowledgment option to print. 
* The user will also have the ability to choose whether to print in Spanish or English. The default will always be English. 
* The user will also have a space to enter in a Club Contact to print on the Invoice. 
* When the user clicks "Print" with "Acknowledgment" selected, the system will download a pdf of the letter according to the provided specifications to the user's computer. 
* The invoice will display differently based on the signing date of the player's CSP. There are currently 2 different versions of the letter to account for - all detailed in the specifications.

title: As a user I want to be able to print a Welcome Kit from the CSP tab of a pro player profile in English
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When "Print Letter" is a button on the CSP tab of the Professional Player Profile
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Print Letter" will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Welcome Kit" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Welcome Kit will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* For the purposes of this story, on "English" is available in the pop-up, and all three radio buttons will work the same and the user will need to enter the address manually (ultimately School/Player will pre-populate these fields but this will be handled in a follow up story). 
* The Print button should be disabled until all required fields have been filled in
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the Questionnaire in English according to the provided requirements.

title: As a user I want to see the batch complete time on the batches screen
custom_preconds: Given User is on batches screen
custom_steps:
When Change the column header "Date" to "Batch Started"
And Change the column header "Full Run" to "Batch Completed"
custom_expected:
* If the batch completed successfully add the date and time in the "Batch Completed" column
* If the batch did not run fully leave the "Batch Completed" column blank

title: As a user I do not want the player static header to take up my entire screen when navigating player profile tabs on screens smaller than 768px
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players profile and screen widths is smaller then 768px
custom_steps: When Clicking on a player name in the profile should still navigate to the Player History tab, even if Summary Info is the first link in the popover
custom_expected:
* Show a "Summary Info" link in the mobile tab popover
* Clicking on the Summary Info link will open a new tab per the wireframe

title: As a user I want all form sections collapsed by default on screen resolutions smaller than 768px
As a user I want to see IBP payments on a player's CEP Payment History
custom_steps: Acceptance Criteria: * IBP Payment lines in player's Payment History match format that displays in ebis1 for IBP payments. * When a player earns an IBP award, the payment displays in the player's Payment History and the Remaining is appropriately adjusted.

title: As a user I want to be able to print a CEP Needs More Info letter from a player's profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=print_letter
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp

Report Layout:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Needs+More+Info+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Needs+More+Info+-+Report+Details

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Print Letter" is a button on the CEP tab of the Professional Player Profile. 
* Clicking "Print Letter" will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Needs More Info" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Needs More Info will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* The Print button should be disabled until all required fields have been filled in
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the Needs More Info letter in the selected language according to the provided requirements.

title: As a user I want approving a contract with a CEP clause to have a CEP tab in the player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=cep

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a MN Contract is approved with a CEP clause in it, a CEP record is created for the player.
* Once the contract has been approved, the player will have a CEP tab on their player profile with a status of "Current". 
* "Responsible Org" will be set to the signing Org. 
* Signing Date will reflect the signing date from the MN Contract. 
* The Living Allowance and Tuition Allowance "Commitments" will be populated using the information entered in the MN Contract's CEP clause. 
* The 10 Year Expiration date will be set to 10 years from the Signing Date.
* Used amounts will all equal 0. 
* Remaining amounts will all equal the committed amounts. 
* This tab will only appear to users who have CSP permissions.

title: As a user I want to edit a CEP tab on a player profile for a player with CEP
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=cep

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The CEP Summary tab has an Edit button in view mode if the user has CSP edit permissions. 
* Clicking edit puts the Summary tab into edit mode, according to the Data Discovery. 
* A Save button and a cancel button are available in Edit mode.
* Clicking "Save" will conduct a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field check has passed, the changes will be saved and a blue successful save notification will be displayed. The page will reload in View mode. 
* Any changes that were made to the Payment History are reflected in the associated Invoice.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are sure that they wish to lose any changes. If they confirm, the form is put back in view mode and no changes are saved. If they do not confirm, the modal is closed and they are returned to the form in edit mode with their changes still present.

title: As a user I want to be able to Save and Print from a CEP Invoice
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When in edit mode on a CEP Invoice, the user will see a "Save & Print" button, in addition to the regular Save and Print buttons. 
* Clicking "Save & Print" will allow the user to select which letter they want to print - just as if they had clicked "Print". 
* After they have chosen the options they want, clicking "Save & Print" will save any changes made to the invoice, display a blue successful save notification and generate a pdf of the selected letter in the chosen language.

title: As a user I want the CEP calc to run whenever an Invoice is saved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is viewing a CSP profile
AND has entered an invoice for an academic term that already has an invoice entered into eBis 1
custom_steps:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Calc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" on an Invoice will prompt the CEP Calc to run. 
* The running of this calc will update the "Used" and "Remaining" values on the summary screen, as well as change the status of the CEP if necessary.

title: As a user I want the CEP calc to run whenever a Credit is saved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is viewing a CSP profile
AND has entered a credit for an academic term that already has an invoice entered into eBis 1
custom_steps:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Calc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" on a Credit will prompt the CEP Calc to run. 
* The running of this calc will update the "Used" and "Remaining" values on the summary screen, as well as change the status of the CEP if necessary.

title: As a user I want to attempting to delete a CEP Credit to run the CEP calc first
custom_steps: Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+CalcMessages:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+MessagesAcceptance Criteria: * Clicking "Delete" on a CEP Credit will run the CEP calc prior to allowing the user to continue with the delete. * In particular the system will check that the deletion of the Credit will not cause the player to exceed the maximum dollar amount allowed for the CEP. If the deletion of the Credit will result in the player exceeding the maximum dollar amount allowed by the CEP, then the delete will not be allowed.* The following are the particular rules that could be violated by a CSP Credit delete:   * You have reached or surpassed the maximum dollar amount allowed for Tuition Allowance. #145003175  * You have reached or surpassed the maximum dollar amount allowed for Living Allowance. #145003171

title: As a user I want to attempting to delete a CEP Invoice to run the CEP calc first
custom_steps: Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+CalcMessages:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+MessagesAcceptance Criteria: * Clicking "Delete" on a CSP Invoice will run the CSP calc prior to allowing the user to continue with the delete. * The following are the particular rules that could be violated by a CSP Credit delete:   * As a user I want to see an error if too much living allowance money has been refunded to a player. #144748883  * As a user I want to see an error if too much tuition allowance money has been refunded to a player. #144496931

title: As a user I want to see an error if too much tuition allowance money has been entered on an invoice (CEP)
custom_steps:
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On each Save of a CEP Invoice, the system should verify that the player's remaining available tuition allowance balance will not be <0. 
* If the dollar amounts entered on the Invoice, in conjunction with all prior invoices and credits,  will cause the tuition allowance balance to be <0, then an error should be displayed. See Messages #47

title: As a user I want to see an error if too much living allowance money has been entered for a player (CEP)
custom_steps:
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On each Save of a CEP Invoice, the system should verify that the player's remaining available living allowance balance will not be <0. 
* If the dollar amounts entered on the Invoice, in conjunction with all prior invoices and credits,  will cause the living allowance balance to be <0, then an error should be displayed. See Messages #48

title: As a user I want the CEP calc to run whenever an Invoice is saved
custom_steps:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Calc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Save" on an Invoice will prompt the CEP Calc to run. 
* The running of this calc will update the "Used" and "Remaining" values on the summary screen, as well as change the status of the CEP if necessary.

title: As a player, I want to be able to login to the mlb.com/scholarship site
custom_preconds:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Players are able to input the last 4 digits of their National ID number (could be letters or numbers). 
* Players are able to enter their Last Name. The Last Name field should NOT be case sensitive, and it should strip any special characters entered (D'Arnaud becomes darnaud).
* Players are able to enter their Date of Birth. 
* A Login button should appear on the screen and be enabled. 
* Clicking "Login" should check the player's entered credentials against the same information from the list of players who have any CSP or CEP clause in their contract. 
* If the credentials match, then the system should log the player into the system, and take them to the Summary page.

title: As a player, I want to be able to view a summary of my CSP
custom_preconds:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Once a player has logged into the mlb.com/scholarship site, the system should check to see if the player has a CSP or a CEP.
* If they have a CSP, the system will need to determine if they signed before or after 10/3/2004.
* If they signed before 10/3/2004, then the system should display the most up to date CSP Summary for the player. The fields displayed should match the attached screenshot of David Aardsma's summary. 
* If they signed on or after 10/3/2004, then the system should display the most up to date CSP Summary for the player. The fields displayed should match the attached screenshot of Brett Austin's summary. 

*Note that the Payment History at the bottom of the Summary is covered in another story*
